page.title: 03Pencombe and the tourist
page.content: Pencombe is well off the beaten track being three miles from the nearest main road. The approach roads are narrow and twisting but the visitor is rewarded by finding a village almost completely unspoilt. Attractive whitewashed stone cottages border a small green and stream. The beauty and isolation attract tourists who stay in holiday cottages at Marston or at the Caravan Club site at Sparrington. Others will visit the area for the outstanding views from the surrounding hills. Welsh and English counties can be seen to the west from the road between Great Hegdon and The Nash and to the south there are views towards the river Severn and the Cotswolds. Anglers can enjoy coarse fishing at New House Farm and rambling and cycling clubs are fond of the area.
